author: petervg
title: A People's Cadastre in Mozambique ✊
description: The rural poor in Mozambique do not have an accessible and affordable way to assert their land rights using government systems.

f6_assessments.q0:
This hits the nail on the head. Establishin land rights is one of the biggest obstacles to people around the world. Blockchain is very well suited for land registries. This project is really bringing the best of Cardano to do great work. 

This is exactly the kind of project that can be replicated in other countries. In fact, this is building on a project in another country, Ghana.
f6_assessments.q1:
This seems like the perfect team for this. They have shown commitment to the problem, as well as tenacity and creativity in trying to solve it. 

Several very experienced people are leaders of the team. The project is showing success in it's pilot program in Ghana.
f6_assessments.q2: There are very clear data points to measure. The calendar is very detailed and extensive. The authors have listed detailed estimates of hours required per task and accounted for reasonable wages - enough to attract good talent who want to do good work. Really excellent planning.

f6_assessments.q0: It is an exciting and potential project in the field of land management. It aims to take advantage of blockchain technology to make land registration easier, more transparent, accurate and reduce the risk of disputes. From there, people have opportunities to use land assets as financial leverage to participate in the DeFi market and help them out of poverty. The broad applicability is also relatively open to African countries with similar cadastral policies. Therefore, this proposal is entirely suitable for the challenge presented. (Score given: 5).
f6_assessments.q1:
The technical solutions outlined above are highly complex, especially in ensuring data accuracy but are relatively feasible. Using Landano's technology is a good idea. It would be more convincing if the team could present evidence to prove the 80,000 DUAT records are accurate, legal, and undisputed.
Economically, the amount demanded and the capital use plan are reasonable; what is missing is the long-term financial plan. The challenges in project implementation are also clearly and accurately recognized. However, legal issues and lobbying for the project's output to be recognized as legally valid have not been discussed and analyzed carefully. A qualified team led by an experienced lawyer is adequate to execute this proposal regarding human resources. (Score given: 4).
f6_assessments.q2: The problems and solutions in the proposal are presented quite clearly and clearly. Roadmap, milestones, and metrics are also realistic and easy to audit. There is only one point that the "complete migration of 80,000 DUAT records into Landano" is a complex task and may take longer than six months. If the team has a specific plan to ensure this is resolved, please add it. (Score given: 4).

In addition, the proposer has aligned with legal sources in the local Mozambique market so it is highly likely the proposal will achieve success since they are definitely aware of the local challenges and deploying solutions.  The team has thoughtfully developed the proposal and has identified potential risks and begun working on solutions.  Another key item to the proposer’s success is the proposal is built off a prior successful proposal which has met prior challenge criteria.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer has provided a solid roadmap and upon further review aligns with the proposers previously successful Fund7 project so I’m confident they can achieve success.  The hourly rate of $75 does seem low for DevOps team however they indicate they already have buy in from the team.  I was impressed with the team and bios and to me they are well versed in African business needs and committed to a critical endeavor.
f6_assessments.q2: It is obvious the proposer has experience in developing these proposals from the outline of specific KPIs which are easily measurable and the outline of success.  Simple and clear I’m confident the project can be managed and measured to completion.

f6_assessments.q0: In Mozambique, there is no accessible and reasonable way to assert their land-use rights using the government system. Solution Importing Mozambican land rights documents into Cardano to generate People's Cadastral using Landano for NFT minting, maps, and web storage3. This will help poor countries that do not have underdeveloped land management systems, but for developed countries, it will be more difficult to change the system of processes in use. Landano Solutions is an independent registry of land rights that provides legal tools on the Cardano blockchain. It also provides web3 archive archiving and discovery capabilities, providing open, trusted data to aid land management in an easy-to-query, mobile-friendly interface powered by maps, permanently store records, and check the integrity of the blockchain. . . The proponent raised the main risks (Miscoordination between the People's Cadastral and Landano teams / Complexity of DUAT source data / Time to map, export and quality control / Project launch depend on delivery schedule Landano MVP / Users with low education level, owning a smartphone, connecting to electricity, internet / It is necessary to bridge the gap between the end-user mobile payment system and cryptocurrencies) However, the solution to reduce the risk should be more detailed such as creating channels or training programs to improve understanding. know and use, coordinate with mobile payment systems if available.
f6_assessments.q1: The roadmap is clearly stated every month and after 6 months with each clear and specific goal. . The proposed cost is calculated according to the unit price and implementation time, but the work items and professional skills are different, so the unit price is different. Storage costs also need to be clear for how long and how much space. The team has 6 employees, information about each employee is provided fully in terms of professional skills and social networking sites, and the job assignment is also clear.
f6_assessments.q2: The KPIs are clearly stated to ensure the quality of the project (Number of codes committed to the DUAT interface / Number of imported DUAT records / Number of imported cadastral data points / Number of DUAT records generated / Gigabyte of space used for DUAT records). . Well-defined success (All existing DUAT records and data objects have been imported into Landano / Landano provides a Portuguese interface for accessing DUATs / DUAT owners can verify the use of their land in Landano). The project is a continuation of the https://cardano.ideascale.com/c/idea/381957 project that was funded at fund 7.

I think, by having trustworthy land management helps people in Mozambique to grow rural farming economies and is key factor for stable government. By holding weekly meetings to coordinate between People's Cadastre and Landano team, I hope this project could solve the challenges.

solution: Import Mozambican land right documents onto Cardano to create a People's Cadastre using Landano for NFT minting, maps, and web3 storage.
experience: We are experienced lawyers, community activists, and Cardano software developers. The Mozambique team has already collected over eighty thousand land right declarations into a custom Cadastre system. The Landano team will use its platform to mint and store these as Cardano NFTs.
